channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2023111070
item.description:
Report X-2023111070

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT ON PD2. WHEN RESPONDER ARRIVED, THEY TOOK DECISION TREE OUT AND PUT THE PROPER PPE ON. THEN CLEANED UP THE SPILL, PUT ON THE BACK OF THE TUG, AND TOOK IT BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING,

item.title: Report X-2023110922
item.description:
Report X-2023110922

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap on the bottles came loose and an internal leakage occurred. The package was brought to QA to be worked on when it was discovered. DescribePack: The package had a visible staining on the outside. Once it was opened, the bottles were noticed to have loose lids. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The contents were placed in a spill tote to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023110798
item.description:
Report X-2023110798

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The caps on two of the bottles came loose and an internal leakage occurred. Upon being found, the item was brought to QA. DescribePack: The package had stains that were eating through it. When the box itself was opened, two of the bottles were noticed to have loose lids. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The contents were placed in a spill tote to prevent further leakage,

item.title: Report X-2023110661

Report X-2023110661

  • City: INDEPENDENCE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA called for leaking hazmat. We tightened the cap and cleaned up the spill with neutralizer. We secured the package and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package placed in lined red tote

item.title: Report X-2023110789
item.description:
Report X-2023110789

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: PADUCAH
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was loaded onto trailer 835069. Package located in the belly, laying upside down. This caused the bottle to leak, damaging the outer packaging. Unload manager contacted QA for proper retrieval and care on 11/6/2023 @ 6am, DescribePack: 4 bottles placed inside of package. Childproof caps with tape over them to prevent spillage. Package placed upside down in belly of trailer when loading it at NASH. Causing caps to leak and spill a 7in hole in side of packaging. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was isolated and removed from area.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap was loose while attempting to unload. The box became wet and QA was called. We tightened the cap and secured the package in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was secured in a lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023110213
item.description:
Report X-2023110213

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: WE GOT CALLED FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT IN THE UNLOAD, RESPONDER PUT ON PPE AND HEADED TO THE LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE OUT AND CLEANED THE SPILL UP BASED ON THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER FINISHED CLEANING UP THE SPILL, HEADED BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023110212
item.description:
Report X-2023110212

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RECIEVED CALL FOR A HAZMAT PACKAGE LEAKING IN A BOX TRUCK. WHEN ARRIVED, RESPONDER PUT THE PROPER PPE ON, USED DECISION TREE OUT, AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. WHEN RESPONDER WAS FINISHED CLEANING UP THE SPILL, BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The metal drum was dropped causing something to puncture it. We cleaned the spill up with absorbent pads. We secured the soiled clean up materials and package in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Body was punctured after being dropped DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed puncture up in a lined red tote

item.title: Report X-2023110655
item.description:
Report X-2023110655

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: BOWLING GREEN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was on pallet with other packages, boxes got tipped and fell on hazmat crushing it. DescribePack: One jug of lime-a-way handle cracked and leaked. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Sort was stopped and QA came over with proper PPE equipment. They followed the hazmat SDS to properly deal with package. They inspected package and were able to contain spillage.
